instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesnâ€™t use intrusion detection. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN:
What is PCH_INTVRMEN? PCH_INTVRMEN is an Internal Voltage Regulator Enable: When pulled high, this signal enables
the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must
remain asserted for the VRMs to behave properly (no glitches allowed).
This signal must be pulled-up to VCCRTC on desktop platforms and may
optionally be pulled low on mobile platforms if using an external VR for the
VCCSUS rail.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
Hi, 

the macbook air had no liquid damage but did not start at all, having checked the signals I replaced the smc, now the macbook starts perfectly the sound the ssd the battery everything works, the only problem is that 'it is impossible to turn it off, when I keep pressing the power button it turns off but restarts, whether with or without battery, or bare motherboard, do you have an idea? I couldn't find anything in the searches.

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R1449</RESISTOR>/52, <RESISTOR>R1617</RESISTOR>/38.
Test the board disconnecting airport card and webcam.
Also test with known good trackpad flex/board.

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1449</RESISTOR> 84kohms
<RESISTOR>R1452</RESISTOR> 9,8komhs
<RESISTOR>R1617</RESISTOR> 96,5komhs
<RESISTOR>R1638</RESISTOR> 90,4kohms
Resistance ok and no short
I tested the motherboard
naked, with smc onoff, same result, turns off then restarts

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
I was expecting the voltage on the signals related with mentioned resistors.
In fact check any kind of WAKE signal.

Also measure the 4 RTC signals.

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
Check pins 1 & 3 of <CHIP>U3560</CHIP>.

Did you solder SMC from donor 00165 board?
Should be good to try another one, just in case.

Be sure <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> stay high when pressing power button.
Machine still restarts if you turn it off by software (from macOS)?

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3560</CHIP> pin 1 3,31v ; pin 3 3,35v
SMC   from donor 00165 board yes
<SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> 3,41v  stay high witch press gnd/<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  3,375v; 3,95v witch press gnd/<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>
with macos big sur, no he's not restarts if i turn it off by software, but won't start with power button

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message: Can you start it triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, instead of using power button?

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
I soldered a wire to <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to try but that doesn't work eithe.
same result with bypass smc

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
What is <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> voltage?
No reaction at all when trigger it?

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message: turn off by the osx I can't do anything impossible to start you have to remove the battery charger to restart, witch <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> or power button same result, <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3,42; when i turn it off with <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> when os x is on the desktop, can't restart it either

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
Did you try to trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> with trackpad flex disconnected?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> and be sure <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is also steady, at same time.

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
with trackpad flex disconnected, shut down by osx, <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>  don't restart and start
<SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> 3,40v stable

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
So actually, machine only starts by itself when connect the charger?

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.
Did you try another SMC?

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't want to go out
threads.message:
So actually, machine only starts by itself when connect the charger? = I can start it with <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> or the power button when it has not been turned off by osx

<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> 3,35 stable 

it must be a smc problem I will try another one but I have few
